name: backbone
content:
backbone noun
(BONES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] the line of bones down the centre of the back that provides support for the body: She stood with her backbone rigid. Synonym
spine (BONE)

backbone noun
(STRENGTH)
the backbone of something
the most important part of something, providing support for everything else: Farming is the backbone of the country's economy.
See more
[ U ] courage and strength of character: [ + to infinitive ] Will he have the backbone to tell them what he thinks?

backbone noun
(BODY PART)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] your spine
backbone noun
(IMPORTANT PART)
[ U ] the part of something that provides strength and support: Newcomers are now the backbone of this team.
backbone noun
(CHARACTER)
[ U ] strength of character or bravery: The delegates had enough backbone to reject the proposal.
the backbone (of sth)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the most important part of something: Small businesses are truly the backbone of the economy. Imaginative ideas may form the backbone of your progress in the future.
COMMUNICATIONS, IT the system of equipment and connections that allows communication at high speeds over long distances: The company runs the biggest internet backbone in the US, carrying about 37% of data traffic.
